And as an actual mental health patient who has had that drug many, many times I'm highly dubious as to the claims, that stuff is pretty strong for a start, I remember the first time I had it my guts were on fire the next morning, took about 2 hours to subside fully, not exactly a side effect most people would be willing to put up with after an obviously biased study result, those figures are way too close to be meaningful, do the math and it's even closer than that since there was 2 more participants in the main group compared to the placebo group, so misleading, is that what Seeker is about now? 🤷

We who practice Transcendental Meditation know exactly what you are describing here.  We experience it when doing group meditations, e.g. when a large group of meditators all practice the technique together.  Research has proved this and it has been dubbed "The Maharishi Effect".

Man that team flow definitely is something I've experienced.
I've got a group of people I've played Monster Hunter with for years and years, and when we hit that flow state, it's freaking magical.
Everyone playing off of each other for setups, positioning in just the right place to break parts or dodge moves, perfect precognition of what the monster is most likely to do, all while carrying an in-depth conversation about something completely off-topic to the point where the game itself just kind of fades and you go into autopilot. Then you fade back in and the quest is over.

It's definitely something when you get a group of friends that you understand on that deep a level and reach a synergy that you can only reach from years of experience playing with each other. That kind of flow feels way different than the kind you get when doing something solo. Ironically it's even a kind of flow that you don't even need to be near someone to have, my friends and I are hundreds of miles apart and still get it like we were sitting right next to each other on the couch.

How does the second study have a p-value that is less than 0.05? It says so in the study but when I tried averaging 20 numbers (to simulate) between 1 and 100 the average deviation was about 3, which is too much when the study participants are between 76% and 81% correct.
EDIT: Found out. It is of course because all the participants doesn't have such a wide span. They probably remember between 60% and 90%, which means the absolute deviation will be less, as it is of course relative deviation that is the same.

Looking in the comments it would seem a lot of people have living experiences of being in a flow state. It's also what you get from people used to work closely with other people investing emotions into it like musicians and actors. Now that science have objectified the experience by pointing to the chemical situation going on and also are acknowledging there's a certain synergy evident between participants but without readily being able to explain it based on the chemistry alone, I think this expresses that science has come as far as it can without allowing for the subjective experience of physical and non-physical phenomena that every single one of us have each and every day of our lives. Enabling us to take the subjective experience in all it's impressionable multifacetted glory seriously from a hard science viewpoint even as it lacks the measurability of objective standarts. This is good, this is the first tentative merging of the spiritual and the scientific searching both of which have driven us equally hard but so far in seemingly opposite directions. That is a true miracle, no less, and with blessed timing too given how we will soon be inhabiting space and thus leave the confines of the planet behind us for good.

Also, btw, a great cudoz to whoever came up with the thumb for this video. That is just pure art of the finest surreal kind.

Inhalt:
➡️ Die Adjuvantien, fälschlicherweise als Hilfsstoffe in Impfstoffen bezeichnet, sind unheimlich gefährlich

➡️ Keine einzige mRNA-Impfung hat jemals in Tierversuchen funktioniert - IM GEGENTEIL!

➡️ In allen Impfstoffstudien werden keine Placebo-Studien durchgeführt - In der Placebogruppe sind die sogenannten Adjuvantien (Hilfssubstanzen) immer enthalten.

➡️ Diese Studien werden in den ärmsten Ländern durchgeführt, bei denen keiner etwas mitbekommt.

Einfügung (JWD): Wenn die von Dr. Jane Ruby präsentierte Meldung, - "UAL-Forscher in Spanien decken die tatsächlichen Inhaltsstoffe im Pfizer-Biontech Impfstoff auf" - zutrifft, dann bestehen die Corona-Impfstoffe fast zu 100% aus Adjuvantien in Form von Graphenoxid-Nanopartikeln. Was wiederum klar macht, dass die Reise in Richtung "Transhumanismus", zu menschlichen Robotern gehen soll.
Untersuchungsergebnis:
"Jede der sechs Impfdosen aus der Impfstoffflasche bestand zu 99,99203% (747 ng) aus0176 23631283 Graphenoxid. Der Rest war RNA 0,00797% (6 ng)."

5HT4 is a type of serotonin receptor. LSD agonises the 5HT2A receptor, and also cures constipation, and migraines. The migraine tablet Sumatriptan agonises the 5HT1B and 5HT1D receptors. And MDMA agonises various 5HT1 and 5HT2 receptors. The wiki page for 5HT receptor is pretty interesting, it has a table outlining the function of each 5HT receptor in the body. I wonder if prucalopride would help autistic people. A lot of autistic people have chronic or frequent constipation, and a lot of very specific memory, but not always the most helpful memory for social situations. If 5HT4 receptors are losing out (stimulation-wise) to other memory receptors (like those associated with fear response) in the autistic brain, autistic people may have that much more difficulty with things like socializing and executive function.

SciShow, come on, man. Unless it was 44 IDENTICAL TWINS in that study, (23 in the group receiving the drug, 21 in placebo group) even SUGGESTING those numbers "81% compared to 76%," could be "evidence" is flat-out stupidity. It is infinitely MORE LIKELY the group receiving the drug simply had 1 or 2 people with superior memories. Or, they had a couple lucky guesses.
Honestly, even if it was 44 genetically created people, who were EXACTLY ALIKE, even THEN I'd be hesitant to call that "evidence."
There are about 10 million theoretical explanations which are possible.
Yours truly,
